moves.1. e4: I hate, i hate openings... every time i see the first move, my mind says "oh non, pas celle-là, encore!!!"
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 Nf6: well, I have to review my Petrov, because i lose more than I used to, when I played against "real people".
moves.3. Nc3: Oh, non! pas les trois cavaliers!
moves.3... d6 4. Bc4 Be7 5. d3 O-O 6. O-O Nc6: and this is the first bizarre move i really do like.
moves.10. Bxe6 fxe6: and I really like this position... For me, it is the best I can achieve when we are both castled king size: my rooks are close to be linked, f-column is my reign and my only weakness cannot be easily attacked. I only fear the possibility of d4, but I usually have time before it.
moves.11. a4: well this is new to me
moves.11... Qd7 12. Nh4: ok, this is a terrible mistake, but we are not here to "analyze" it
moves.12... Bxh4 13. Qg4 Qe7: I made a mistake here. not to big, but though: my queen is overcharged of defense: h4, e6 and c7.
moves.14. Nb5 Bg5: i tryed to discharge... but why didn't I go back to f6? Because I wanted not to lose tempo for my f-column, even at the cost of a pawn
pawn lost? No, no... let's see the next moves.
moves.19. gxh4: forced and this is a terrible situation, by the way.
moves.19... Qe7: i hoped he would go away...
moves.20... Nxe7 21. a5: thank you again: the h-pawn is definetely mine. Could have saved it (temporarily) with 21. Kg2 and 22. Rh1.
moves.21... Ng6 22. h5 Nf4 23. Kh2 Nxh5 24. Ra: i guess in my mind it was: the piece you have has to be the one active. It took time to me to appreciate Knights, but now I really do love them.
moves.26. b4 Rf6 27. b5: that is a nice attempt to strike back by the way. All the credit to shammer not to resign. He found good ideas, according to me
moves.29... Ra8: not Rc6 30. Rb6 and I am in terrible mess...
moves.30. Rb6 Nc3 31. c5 Na4: Maybe taking directly 31. ... dxc was better. but I was preoccupied by the potential arriving of the second rook
moves.32. Rxd6 Nxc5 33. Rd5 Rc6: ok, take my e-pawn, i take your d-pawn
moves.37. Re7: last attempt to scare me, but it was pretty obvious, no?
moves.37... Rg6 38. Rf1 Rc5 39. f4: oh, no, another attempt, true... but this accelerate the end
moves.39... Rc2+ 40. Kh3 Nf2+ 41. Kh4 Nxe4: woups, threats mate in one! You cannot take my horse...
moves.42. Rf3 Rh2+ 43. Rh3 Rxh3+ 44. Kxh3 Nc5: and finally thanks for this last mistake... But I enjoyed the game for the nice bizarre situations... Probably didn't deserve the annotation, but I liked it
